flow.descriptionCdata:
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.084d1625-b95b-469f-9194-dc39859b24d1.description=
Sleeps for the number of seconds specified in the input.

Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for the number of seconds given as input.
failure - Was unable to sleep for some reason.
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.0c27e210-e37f-40d7-b7f6-4b40deeecc6e.prompt=Enter a value for corePassword e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.0d65c50b-231d-4b80-83aa-395f09dff56d.description=
Subtracts two numbers

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The difference of the two numbers.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.1616553e-f851-4fdf-b19f-febddd997f8c.prompt=Enter a value for coreHost e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.1b9bd6da-dc33-46d9-8e5a-dd2555383b6f.description=
Retrieve information about a virtual machine or a group of virtual machines in a datacenter or host system (pipe-delimited). Retrieve each object one at a time from an initial search query ala SQL Query operation.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type.
hostSystem - Target virtual machine host system.
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
getDetailed - Retrieve detailed information?

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no more - there are no more results to retrieve.

Returns\:
vmInfo - Virtual machine information.
numberOfResults - Number of results from the query remaining to be retrieved.
returnResult - Virtual machine ID or operation results.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.1f90de31-c570-45f2-96d8-c3486eefdcb5.prompt=Enter a value for value1 e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.247b48af-959f-4eeb-9c79-5f1fc6a3c001.prompt=Enter a value for coreUsername e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.3fda2552-867f-46c9-93e2-aae687a36ae7.description=Flex up a VM to the specific CPU Memory and Disk that is requested. Input Parameters\: serviceName -name of the service that will be created with this flow VCenterHost - vCenter host to execute against VCenterUsername - vCenter username VCenterPassword - vCenter password. virtualMachine - This is the virtual machine that will be flexed. vmDatacenter - target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs clusterName - target cluster for the VMs vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs cpuCount - number of cpus the virtual machine should have. memSize - amount of memory the virtual machine should have. addDisk - whether or not disk should be added to the vm. Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: NA e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.42c41e76-4040-4c01-8f2f-90a042768fd9.prompt=Enter a value for targetHosts e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.42f4649b-ca86-4ea5-a63b-fd0bde5432b3.prompt=Enter a value for corePassword e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.49c55719-2d0a-4341-8ea6-c6c30c1b8ba0.description=
Divides two numbers

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1/value2

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.4a6a9c6e-8487-424b-8a80-f5364550a80d.prompt=Enter password e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.4c15acb8-d0b9-423a-ad8e-33492fe6ea02.prompt=Virtual Machine name\: e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.58ebe2ff-2bc7-4e97-9890-a64662f067c7.prompt=Virtual Machine\: e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.8679f231-8d40-4a67-b63c-42a2bf796325.description=
Checks if a number or word is greater than another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1 > value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.88cb2ee9-674d-41a4-9e4e-7431ba81bbde.prompt=Enter a value for value1 e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.8f78933f-8020-49ef-822e-7491e59fdeef.description=
Sets the power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,paused). Does nothing if the virtual machine is already in the power state.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
async - Asynchronously perform the task
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds)
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123)
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type
vmPowerState - Virtual machine power state to set (poweredOn, poweredOff, suspended).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no action - The operation completed with no action performed.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task ID or task completion return message.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.956e8897-9fe6-41ee-82d5-6cc23d755110.prompt=Enter a value for coreHost e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.9a1ba374-128c-40ee-9131-f6ab21ad818b.prompt=Enter a value for coreUsername e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.9a40c61a-e4b7-4fc1-af1e-c22f76bf7825.prompt=Enter user e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.9ddc68f3-83d7-445b-b42d-823eb211d1f4.description=
Start a Run Script process using the given parameters on specified list of target servers (Not supported for SA 6.x).

Inputs\:
coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core.
corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on.
coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS.
coreVersion - The core version.
coreUsername - The username for host.
corePassword - The password for host.
scriptToRun - Name of the script to execute.
args - Arguments to pass to the script.
scriptTimeout - Script timeout.
targetHosts - Hosts to execute the scripts on. Should be a ',' seperated list of names or search expressions.
targetUser - Username to execute the scripts as.
targetPassword - Password for the username specified.
targetDomain - Windows domain name (if required).
ticketId - ticketId to associate with job
notificationFailureOwner - sets the email address of the owner of this job when the job fails
notificationSuccessOwner - sets the email address of the owner of this job when the job succeeds
notificationFailureRecipients - a comma delimited list of the email addresses to notify when this job fails
notificationSuccessRecipients - a comma delimited list of the email addresses to notify when this job succeeds

Responses\:
success - retrieved successfully
failure - failed to retrieve data

Returns\:
id - The unique ID of this object.
description - The description of this object.
blockedReason - The reason why this job is blocked.
cancelledReason - The reason why this job is canceled.
endDate - The date at which this job will cease to run.
notificationFailureOwner - The user who will own this job if it fails.
notificationSuccessOwner - The user who will own this job if it completes.
notificationFailureRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job fails.
notificationSuccessRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job completes.
serverName - The name of the server associated with this job.
serverId - The id of the server associated with this job.
staleDate - The date after which this job is considered stale.
startDate - The date where this job started.
status - This object's status.
username - This object's user name.
userTag - This object's unique user tag.
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.abf0fb30-60f1-495b-93cb-910ddd1f74cd.prompt=Enter a value for targetHosts e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.c090a2b5-7f87-47e3-b7e2-753d0c5c3ea6.description=
Destroy / delete an object in VMWare.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
async - Asynchronously perform the task
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds)
propsRootObjType - VMWare object type (eg. VirtualMachine, HostSystem, ComputeResource,ResourcePool,Alarm)
propsRootObj - VMWare object ID

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task ID or task completion return message
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.ca83715f-8834-4d6a-8d9c-61ce20eccc29.description=
Sleeps for the number of seconds specified in the input.

Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for the number of seconds given as input.
failure - Was unable to sleep for some reason.
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.d4bd830d-dfa2-4823-a17b-dd31ea0de698.description=
Checks if a number or word is greater than or equal to another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1 >\= value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.d4c451cf-9511-4bab-8d1a-24221d80fbbc.prompt=Enter a value for value1 e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.description=
Create a VM from a VM template. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs.

Input Parameters\:
 vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow
 templateName -  name of the VM template to clone in vCenter
 osType - linux or windows
 host -  vCenter host to execute against
 user - vCenter username
 password - vCenter password
 vmDatacenter -  target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs
 dataStore -  target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs
 hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs
 clusterName - target cluster for the VMs
 vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs
 clusterName - Name of the VMWare HA or DRS cluster
 CPUs - Number of cpus to be set on the VMs
 Memory - Amount of Memory in MB to be set on VMs. Memory should be a multiple of 4.
 port - Port Number toconnect on
 protocol - Connection prtocol(http, https)
 availableCPU - Available CPU in  vCenter
 availableMemory - Available
 Memory in MB in vCenter
 disksize - Additional Disk size other than the boot disk.. A new disk space will be allocated as a new partition.
 custnetwork - Network the Server to be associated. The network should be defined as part of the VM Clone template.
 SAhost - Core Host
 SApassword - Core Password
 SAprotocol - Core Protocol
 SAusername - Core Username
 flexup - true/false for Flexing
 provision - Is the provision or Flexing - true/false


Note - Currently, CSA 3.0 is not using this functionality
Responses\:
   success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0
   failure - otherwise
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.e022a855-cdcb-4236-8260-a7fc9b01a0f8.description=
Clone a virtual machine. The virtual machine may be a template vm. The source virtual machine is specified via vmIdentifierType and virtualMachine (optionally vmDatacenter) while the target configuration is defined by vmName,vmFolder,vmResourcePool,dataStore,hostSystem, and clusterName.

Note\: cannot work across virtual datacenters

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123)
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type
async - Asynchronously perform the task
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds)
vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter
vmName - Virtual machine name being created (new)
vmFolder - Virtual machine's folder by inventory path, / delimited not including datacenter (eg. ManagedVMs/DRS/Location1). For root folder, use /
vmResourcePool - Virtual machine's resource pool
dataStore - Datastore (eg. host\:dsname, mydatastore)
hostSystem - Target virtual machine host system
clusterName - Name of the VMWare HA or DRS cluster
markAsTemplate - Mark the virtual machine as a template? Mark as regular virtual machine otherwise
customizationTemplateName - Customization template name to use on the existing virtual machine or on the newly created one if a new VM is being created.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task result or operation result.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.e3ed7187-ad82-411d-b01f-f509e2f0c4bd.description=
Start a Run Script process using the given parameters on specified list of target servers (Not supported for SA 6.x).

Inputs\:
coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core.
corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on.
coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS.
coreVersion - The core version.
coreUsername - The username for host.
corePassword - The password for host.
scriptToRun - Name of the script to execute.
args - Arguments to pass to the script.
scriptTimeout - Script timeout.
targetHosts - Hosts to execute the scripts on. Should be a ',' seperated list of names or search expressions.
targetUser - Username to execute the scripts as.
targetPassword - Password for the username specified.
targetDomain - Windows domain name (if required).
ticketId - ticketId to associate with job
notificationFailureOwner - sets the email address of the owner of this job when the job fails
notificationSuccessOwner - sets the email address of the owner of this job when the job succeeds
notificationFailureRecipients - a comma delimited list of the email addresses to notify when this job fails
notificationSuccessRecipients - a comma delimited list of the email addresses to notify when this job succeeds

Responses\:
success - retrieved successfully
failure - failed to retrieve data

Returns\:
id - The unique ID of this object.
description - The description of this object.
blockedReason - The reason why this job is blocked.
cancelledReason - The reason why this job is canceled.
endDate - The date at which this job will cease to run.
notificationFailureOwner - The user who will own this job if it fails.
notificationSuccessOwner - The user who will own this job if it completes.
notificationFailureRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job fails.
notificationSuccessRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job completes.
serverName - The name of the server associated with this job.
serverId - The id of the server associated with this job.
staleDate - The date after which this job is considered stale.
startDate - The date where this job started.
status - This object's status.
username - This object's user name.
userTag - This object's unique user tag.
e7fe5232-7025-48ae-914b-a6d61cdb5400.fa20bdd3-ec09-4343-ab48-ca3f86f95340.description=
Destroy / delete an object in VMWare.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
async - Asynchronously perform the task
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds)
propsRootObjType - VMWare object type (eg. VirtualMachine, HostSystem, ComputeResource,ResourcePool,Alarm)
propsRootObj - VMWare object ID

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task ID or task completion return message
flow.name: vCenter Create Clone
